## Description {#details}

This file declares the MachineIRBuilder class.

This is a helper class to build MachineInstr.

<Link id="l00520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="520"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Materialize and insert \\p Res = G&#95;PTR&#95;ADD \\p Op0, (G&#95;CONSTANT \\p Value)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00671" /><CodeLine lineNumber="671"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Build and insert \\p Res = G&#95;ANYEXT \\p Op0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00672" /><CodeLine lineNumber="672"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00673" /><CodeLine lineNumber="673"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// G&#95;ANYEXT produces a register of the specified width, with bits 0 to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00674" /><CodeLine lineNumber="674"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// sizeof(\\p Ty) &#42; 8 set to \\p Op. The remaining bits are unspecified</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00675" /><CodeLine lineNumber="675"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// (i.e. this is neither zero nor sign-extension). For a vector register,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00676" /><CodeLine lineNumber="676"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// each element is extended individually.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00677" /><CodeLine lineNumber="677"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00678" /><CodeLine lineNumber="678"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\pre setBasicBlock or setMI must have been called.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00679" /><CodeLine lineNumber="679"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\pre \\p Res must be a generic virtual register with scalar or vector type.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00680" /><CodeLine lineNumber="680"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\pre \\p Op must be a generic virtual register with scalar or vector type.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00681" /><CodeLine lineNumber="681"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\pre \\p Op must be smaller than \\p Res</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00682" /><CodeLine lineNumber="682"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00683" /><CodeLine lineNumber="683"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\return The newly created instruction.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00684" /><CodeLine lineNumber="684"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00685" /><CodeLine lineNumber="685"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstrbuilder">MachineInstrBuilder</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineirbuilder/#acac15566596b1d588d87450ab77bf0d7">buildAnyExt</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dstop">DstOp</a> &amp;Res, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/srcop">SrcOp</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00686" /><CodeLine lineNumber="686"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00687" /><CodeLine lineNumber="687"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Build and insert \\p Res = G&#95;SEXT \\p Op</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00688" /><CodeLine lineNumber="688"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00689" /><CodeLine lineNumber="689"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// G&#95;SEXT produces a register of the specified width, with bits 0 to</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00692" /><CodeLine lineNumber="692"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00693" /><CodeLine lineNumber="693"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\pre setBasicBlock or setMI must have been called.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00694" /><CodeLine lineNumber="694"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\pre \\p Res must be a generic virtual register with scalar or vector type.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00695" /><CodeLine lineNumber="695"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\pre \\p Op must be a generic virtual register with scalar or vector type.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00696" /><CodeLine lineNumber="696"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\pre \\p Op must be smaller than \\p Res</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00697" /><CodeLine lineNumber="697"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01670" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1670"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Val if the original value is greater than or equal to \\p Val, or leaves it</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01671" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1671"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// unchanged otherwise. Puts the original value from \\p Addr in \\p OldValRes.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01672" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1672"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01874" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1874"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01875" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1875"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\pre setBasicBlock or setMI must have been called.</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01878" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1878"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
